title: Whitehall cleaners are sacked after living wage plea
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Whitehall cleaners are sacked after living wage plea Philip Hammond is facing calls to help the group of 14 Foreign Office cleaners who were disciplined by the contractor which employs them Suzanne Plunkett/Reuters Google+ 1 of 1 Philip Hammond is facing calls to help the group of 14 Foreign Office cleaners who were disciplined by the contractor which employs them Suzanne Plunkett/Reuters Michael Savage Chief Political Correspondent Published at 12:01AM, October 19 2015 
A group of Foreign Office cleaners have been disciplined for writing to a cabinet minister asking for the living wage. 
Philip Hammond, the foreign secretary, is facing calls to help the 14 workers who signed a letter asking for a meeting over the issue. Some have since been made redundant. 
The Conservatives have been accused of hypocrisy after attempting to rebrand themselves as the “workers’ party” following George Osborne’s announcement of a national living wage of £7.20 from next April. Campaigners say it needs to be set at £9.15 in London.
